info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued November 27 at 3:17PM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PST THURSDAY FOR LA PINE... Oregon Department of Environmental Quality has issued an Air Quality Advisory...IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PST THURSDAY. The Oregon Department of Enviornmental Quality has issued an air quality advisory for La Pine due to stagnant air conditions trapping smoke and other air pollutants near the ground where people breathe. Many county health and local air agencies have also issued wood burning restrictions limiting the use of wood stoves, fireplaces, and outdoor burning. There are often exceptions for those who use wood exclusively to heat their homes and those with limited income. Check with your local health or air agency for current restrictions. People can take the following precautions to protect their health: - Follow local burn restrictions to prevent deteriorating air quality. - Avoid strenuous outdoor acitivity in smoky conditions. - People with heart or lung problems and young children are expecially vulnerable. These people should stay indoors while smoke levels are high. - Use certified High Efficiency Particulate Air (HEPA) filters in indoor heating, ventilation, cooling, and air purification systems. - Avoid using wood-burning stoves and other sources of indoor smoke if possible. For additional information...please visit the Web site at http://www.oregon.gov/DEQ
